justification: “Participants performed the WM tasks in the following order: symmetry span, digit span, visual array, and operation span,” indicating the symmetry-span task was used to measure WM capacity.
The paper lists “digit span” among “four tasks measuring WM capacity,” showing digit-span was an instrument for working-memory capacity.
The methods section names the “visual array task” as one of the “WM tasks… measuring WM capacity,” so this task serves as a WM measure.
Operation span is included in the set of “four tasks measuring WM capacity,” identifying it as a measurement instrument for working memory.

measured_by: Recency parameter (R) from the expectancy-valence learning model
justification: “The recency model… has two parameters—recency (R) and exploration (c)… Estimates of R obtained from the recency model were then used to analyze recency,” showing that the R parameter operationalizes the construct of recency.
